page.title: 03Achahoish Graveyard
page.content: Achahoish Graveyard is reached by going through a gate beside the old and new Ellary bridges, and following a path for about 50 metres. One of the stones in the graveyard is that of Katie McLellan aged 2 who strayed from home on Saturday 16th April 1892. Next day a search party of over 100 assembled on the hill. A shepherd found Katie's body lying on a grassy green patch 2 miles from her home. A large number of the search party proceeded to the spot where the remains were found and in accordance with an old Highland custom erected a cairn of white stones gathered from the hillside. This can still be seen on Ellary hillside and to visit it and read the inscription on it makes a pleasant afternoon's walk.
